Key Match Events: Lautaro Martínez scored the fastest hat-trick in World Cup history
Argentina secured top spot in Group A with a 2-0 victory over Peru
Leandro Paredes missed a penalty but it did not prove costly
Peru failed to threaten despite having six shots in the game
Pre-Game Insights: Lionel Messi was out due to a groin injury
Manager Lionel Scaloni served a touchline ban
Argentina needed to maintain their winning streak to ensure top spot
Post-Match Reflections: Martínez retained his golden touch, scoring in all three group games
Argentina has won their first three matches of a CONMEBOL Copa América tournament on 18 occasions
Argentina averaged 74% possession against Peru, matching their second-highest possession rate in the CONMEBOL Copa América since at least the 2011 edition
Argentina concluded their participation in the group stage without conceding any goals while scoring all their goals after half-time
Lautaro Martínez finished the group stage as the Argentine player with the most shots (9) and the most goals (4)
Miscellaneous Highlights: Argentina recorded their 13th victory against Peru in the CONMEBOL Copa América in 18 meetings
Out of the last 16 penalties taken against Peru in the CONMEBOL Copa América (including shootouts), seven were not converted (44%)
